mortar.bundler

Interface Bundler


  • public interface Bundler
    Implemented by objects that want to persist via the bundle.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getMortarBundleKey()
      The key that will identify the bundles passed to this instance via onLoad(android.os.Bundle) and onSave(android.os.Bundle).
      void onEnterScope(MortarScope scope)
      Like Scoped.onEnterScope(mortar.MortarScope), called synchronously when a bundler is registered with a BundleService.
      void onExitScope() 
      void onLoad(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Called when this object is registered, and each time BundleServiceRunner.onCreate(android.os.Bundle) is called (e.g.
      void onSave(android.os.Bundle outState)
      Called from the BundleServiceRunner.onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle), to allow the receiver to save state before the process is killed.

    • Method Detail

      • onEnterScope

        void onEnterScope(MortarScope scope)
        Like Scoped.onEnterScope(mortar.MortarScope), called synchronously when a bundler is registered with a BundleService.

      • getMortarBundleKey

        java.lang.String getMortarBundleKey()
        The key that will identify the bundles passed to this instance via onLoad(android.os.Bundle) and onSave(android.os.Bundle).

      • onLoad

        void onLoad(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Called when this object is registered, and each time BundleServiceRunner.onCreate(android.os.Bundle) is called (e.g. after a configuration change like rotation, or after the app process is respawned). Callers should assume that the initial call to this method is made asynchronously, but be prepared for a synchronous call.

        Note that receivers are likely to outlive multiple activity instances, and so receive multiple calls of this method. Implementations should be prepared to ignore saved state if they are already initialized.

        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - the state written by the most recent call to onSave(android.os.Bundle), or null if that has never happened.

      • onSave

        void onSave(android.os.Bundle outState)
        Called from the BundleServiceRunner.onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle), to allow the receiver to save state before the process is killed. Note that receivers are likely to outlive multiple activity instances, and so receive multiple calls of this method. Any state required to revive a new instance of the receiver in a new process should be written out each time, as there is no way to know if the app is about to hibernate.
        Parameters:
        outState - a bundle to write any state that needs to be restored if the plugin is revived

      • onExitScope

        void onExitScope()
